title: Low throughput protocol for immunoprecipitation followed by mass spectrometry of cells stably expressing an HA-tagged protein
title_html: Low throughput protocol for immunoprecipitation followed by mass spectrometry of cells stably expressing an HA-tagged protein

source.body: Use 1.5 mL tubes, not 2 mL for the IP, as the conical shape is more ideal for pelleting the beads/washing in subsequent steps.

Repeat spin/wash step 3 more times for a total of 4 x 1 mL washes with detergent present:
Perform 3 x 1 mL washes in the absence of detergent 50mM Tris/150mM NaCl, without NP-40:
Carefully aspirate remaining wash buffer. Use gel loading tip and pipettor to remove as close to beads as possible.

source.body: Can use P3111 capillary tips which are smaller than the agarose resin, but not entirely necessary, beads do not have to be dry.

description: Analysis of protein complexes by mass spectrometry provides a powerful approach for identifying proteins that associate with other proteins. Frequently, this can be done by expressing the protein of interest with an epitope tag, such as a Hemagglutinin-A (HA) epitope, using either a stably expressed lentivirus or by gene editing the HA epitope into the gene of interest. The protocol has been used extensively to create the Bioplex protein interaction network [Huttlin et al Nature. 545:505-509 (2017); Huttlin et al Cell, 162: 425-440 (2015)].
